title: Have you visited Nashik's wine resort? (Anshuman A.)
text: By Anshuman A. Jul 17, 2015 We all like to try new things and experimenting with food, drinks and exploring different locations. We often plan trips to places for excursions, to enjoy, to relax, to explore new cities and for adventure. But, how many times have we tried to plan a visit to India's favorite destination of Wine and grapes for the purpose of wine tasting? If you have missed it, get going now!We know that Nashik, a city in the state of Maharashtra, is located at 600m above sea level that makes it India's northern most regions where grapes are produced easily. The big diurnal variation in day and night temperatures is suitable for creating better balance of sugar, acid and flavors in wines at this place and hence, the city is popularly known as the sssWine capital of India as it is a leading producer of grapes and wine in the country.There are not one, but many resorts in Nashik that you can explore or plan to stay at during a your visit to the city but, when it comes to wine tasting experience, Soma Vine Village, a Nashik wine resort, is where you can taste different wines and also, understand the process that they use to make wines that win hearts of the visitors. The resort is situated amidst the serene beauty Nashik, set on a scenic view of Gangapur Dam back waters and at present is centrally located among the country's finest wineries.If you wish to indulge in the beautiful and pleasant surroundings of the Wine capital of India, visiting Nashik vineyards resort like Soma Vine Village could be an exhilarating experience for you that will add some romance in your life. The resort offers facilities that will bring back all your rejuvenating and romantic moments of the past. A tranquil setup that settled in the gorgeous city of Nashik is a customer's delight and the wine tasting session is like a cherry on top. An exciting and adventurous 3 hour drive from Mumbai and the mesmerizing ambience of the resort are truly the things you can look forward to!The magnificent hill view and the tranquil lake view from the resort rooms will surely add to your experience at the resort. You could also choose to stay for a day or two to explore the vineyards that are maintained for growing grapes, creating a picturesque view with the lush green plantations and the splendid environment. While you plan your visit to Nashik, you can also be a part of the mega event that is about to begin in the city, Kumbh Mela 2015, which is the world's largest gathering of devotees. Kumbh Mela takes place once in every 12 years in Nashik. You can be a part of that as well during your stay at the Nashik wine resort, the Soma Vine Village.Nashik has various other resorts as well! You can explore other options as well. About the Author The author is fond of tasting wine and has been exploring different wine resorts in the Wine Capital from past few years. He often speaks about his experiences in his writings about the nashik wine resort and nashik vineyards resort . Rating:
